text: Lancaster is a city in Grant County, Wisconsin, United States.. As of the 2020 census, 3,907 people lived there. Lancaster is the county seat of Grant County. ==History== Major G.M. Price laid out the town in 1837. He was asked to name it Lancaster by a relative who came from Lancaster, Pennsylvania. Lancaster was the home of the first governor of Wisconsin, Nelson Dewey. ==Geography== Lancaster is located in the unglaciated "Driftless Area" of southwest Wisconsin. Its topography is very different from that of the rest of the state. The city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==Notable people== *George Barnett - Commandant of the United States Marine Corps *Lisle Blackbourn - NFL head coach *William Simon U'Ren - Oregon politician ==References== ==Other websites== * City of Lancaster official website Category:Cities in Wisconsin Category:Grant County, Wisconsin Category:County seats in Wisconsin Category:1837 establishments in Wisconsin Territory
title: Lancaster, Wisconsin
